abstract.text: Installs a trigger with a callback on a buffer queue.

The condition to be tested when evaluating the trigger.

The time value to compare against when evaluating the trigger. Must be numeric (ie. not invalid, indefinite, or infinite), except for certain trigger conditions which ignores it (eg, kCMBufferQueueTrigger_WhenMinPresentationTimeStampChanges).
Address where created trigger token will be written. Can be
, if client has no need to explicitly test or remove the trigger. Cannot be
when triggerCallback is
,  since the trigger would be meaningless then.
A result code. See
The returned trigger token can be passed to
and
. The
parameter can be
(client doesn’t need to test or remove trigger), and the
parameter can be

(client doesn’t need callbacks, but rather will explicitly test the trigger).  One of these two parameters must be non-NULL, however, since an untestable trigger that does not perform a callback is meaningless.  If the trigger condition is already true,
will call the triggerCallback and will first write the trigger token to *triggerTokenOut.

abstract.text: Represent time-based audio-visual assets with essential data types.
A reference to a buffer queue instance.
Installs a trigger with a callback on a buffer queue.
Installs a trigger with a handler on a buffer queue.
Installs a trigger with a handler and threshold on a buffer queue.
Installs a trigger with a callback and threshold on a buffer queue.
Tests whether the trigger condition is true for the specified buffer queue.
A callback for the system to invoke when a trigger condition becomes true.
A type to specify conditions to associate with a buffer queue trigger.
A type alias for a trigger handler.
A type alias for a trigger token.
The trigger conditions the framework supports.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
